info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:51PM CDT until May 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHERN CARSON COUNTIES... At 250 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Washburn, or 11 miles southwest of Panhandle, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 243 PM CDT, trained spotters reported ping pong ball size hail near Washburn. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Panhandle, White Deer, Groom and Washburn. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
